story.text: (Adds details, Reuters Estimates)Jan 3 (Reuters) - Trans World Entertainment Corp. (TWMC.O) reported a 6 percent decline in same-store sales for the five-week period ended Dec. 30, 2006 and cut its earnings estimates for the current fiscal year on lower-than-expected sales for the holiday season. The company lowered its earnings forecast for the current fiscal year to a range of flat to 5 cents a share from its earlier view of 10 cents to 20 cents a share, the music, video and video game retailer said in a statement. For the full year, analysts on average expect the company to earn 4 cents a share, before exceptional items, according to Reuters Estimates. Trans World Entertainment said total sales for the five-week period increased 23 percent to $348 million compared with $284 million for the same period last year. The company said it posted a 6 percent decline in same-store sales for the eleven-month period ended Dec. 30, 2006. Total sales for the period increased 17 percent to $1.4 billion from $1.2 billion in the year-ago period, it added. (Reporting by Dilipp S. Nag in Bangalore)
story.title: update 1 - trans world posts lower dec . sales , cuts earnings view
